00053         template<typename T>
00054         class AlignedBox3
00055         {
00056         public:
00057                 enum Extent
00058                 {
00059                         EXTENT_NULL,
00060                         EXTENT_FINITE,
00061                         EXTENT_INFINITE
00062                 };
00063         protected:
00064 
00065                 vector<3,T> mMinimum;
00066                 vector<3,T> mMaximum;
00067                 Extent mExtent;
00068                 mutable vector<3,T>* mpCorners;
00069 
00070         public:
00071                 /*
00072                 1-----2
00073                 /|    /|
00074                 / |   / |
00075                 5-----4  |
00076                 |  0--|--3
00077                 | /   | /
00078                 |/    |/
00079                 6-----7
00080                 */
00081                 typedef enum {
00082                         FAR_LEFT_BOTTOM = 0,
00083                         FAR_LEFT_TOP = 1,
00084                         FAR_RIGHT_TOP = 2,
00085                         FAR_RIGHT_BOTTOM = 3,
00086                         NEAR_RIGHT_BOTTOM = 7,
00087                         NEAR_LEFT_BOTTOM = 6,
00088                         NEAR_LEFT_TOP = 5,
00089                         NEAR_RIGHT_TOP = 4
00090                 } CornerEnum;
00091                 inline AlignedBox3() : mMinimum(vector<3,T>::Zero()), mMaximum(vector<3,T>::Ones()), mpCorners(0)
00092                 {
00093                         // Default to a null box 
00094                         setMinimum( -0.5, -0.5, -0.5 );
00095                         setMaximum( 0.5, 0.5, 0.5 );
00096                         mExtent = EXTENT_NULL;
00097                 }
00098                 inline AlignedBox3(Extent e) : mMinimum(vector<3,T>::Zero()), mMaximum(vector<3,T>::Ones()), mpCorners(0)
00099                 {
00100                         setMinimum( -0.5, -0.5, -0.5 );
00101                         setMaximum( 0.5, 0.5, 0.5 );
00102                         mExtent = e;
00103                 }
00104 
00105                 inline AlignedBox3(const AlignedBox3 & rkBox) : mMinimum(vector<3,T>::Zero()), mMaximum(vector<3,T>::Ones()), mpCorners(0)
00106 
00107                 {
00108                         if (rkBox.isNull())
00109                                 setNull();
00110                         else if (rkBox.isInfinite())
00111                                 setInfinite();
00112                         else
00113                                 setExtents( rkBox.mMinimum, rkBox.mMaximum );
00114                 }
00115 
00116                 inline AlignedBox3( const vector<3,T>& min, const vector<3,T>& max ) : mMinimum(vector<3,T>::Zero()), mMaximum(vector<3,T>::Ones()), mpCorners(0)
00117                 {
00118                         setExtents( min, max );
00119                 }
00120 
00121                 inline AlignedBox3(
00122                         float mx, float my, float mz,
00123                         float Mx, float My, float Mz ) : mMinimum(vector<3,T>::Zero()), mMaximum(vector<3,T>::Ones()), mpCorners(0)
00124                 {
00125                         setExtents( mx, my, mz, Mx, My, Mz );
00126                 }

00128                 AlignedBox3& operator=(const AlignedBox3& rhs)
00129                 {
00130                         // Specifically override to avoid copying mpCorners
00131                         if (rhs.isNull())
00132                                 setNull();
00133                         else if (rhs.isInfinite())
00134                                 setInfinite();
00135                         else
00136                                 setExtents(rhs.mMinimum, rhs.mMaximum);
00137 
00138                         return *this;
00139                 }
00140 
00141                 ~AlignedBox3()
00142                 {
00143                         if (mpCorners) 
00144                         {
00145                                 delete[] mpCorners;
00146                                 mpCorners = NULL;
00147                         }
00148                 }

00252                 inline void setExtents( const vector<3,T>& min, const vector<3,T>& max )
00253                 {
00254             assert( (min.x() <= max.x() && min.y() <= max.y() && min.z() <= max.z()) &&
00255                 "The minimum corner of the box must be less than or equal to maximum corner" );
00256 
00257                         mExtent = EXTENT_FINITE;
00258                         mMinimum = min;
00259                         mMaximum = max;
00260                 }
00261 
00262                 inline void setExtents(
00263                         T mx, T my, T mz,
00264                         T Mx, T My, T Mz )
00265                 {
00266             assert( (mx <= Mx && my <= My && mz <= Mz) &&
00267                 "The minimum corner of the box must be less than or equal to maximum corner" );
00268 
00269                         mExtent = EXTENT_FINITE;
00270 
00271                         mMinimum.x() = mx;
00272                         mMinimum.y() = my;
00273                         mMinimum.z() = mz;
00274 
00275                         mMaximum.x() = Mx;
00276                         mMaximum.y() = My;
00277                         mMaximum.z() = Mz;
00278 
00279                 }
00280 
00305                 inline const vector<3,T>* getAllCorners(void) const
00306                 {
00307                         assert( (mExtent == EXTENT_FINITE) && "Can't get corners of a null or infinite AAB" );
00308 
00309                         // The order of these items is, using right-handed co-ordinates:
00310                         // Minimum Z face, starting with Min(all), then anticlockwise
00311                         //   around face (looking onto the face)
00312                         // Maximum Z face, starting with Max(all), then anticlockwise
00313                         //   around face (looking onto the face)
00314                         // Only for optimization/compatibility.
00315                         if (!mpCorners)
00316                                 mpCorners = new vector<3,T>[8];
00317 
00318                         mpCorners[0] = mMinimum;
00319                         mpCorners[1].x() = mMinimum.x(); mpCorners[1].y() = mMaximum.y(); mpCorners[1].z() = mMinimum.z();
00320                         mpCorners[2].x() = mMaximum.x(); mpCorners[2].y() = mMaximum.y(); mpCorners[2].z() = mMinimum.z();
00321                         mpCorners[3].x() = mMaximum.x(); mpCorners[3].y() = mMinimum.y(); mpCorners[3].z() = mMinimum.z();            
00322 
00323                         mpCorners[4] = mMaximum;
00324                         mpCorners[5].x() = mMinimum.x(); mpCorners[5].y() = mMaximum.y(); mpCorners[5].z() = mMaximum.z();
00325                         mpCorners[6].x() = mMinimum.x(); mpCorners[6].y() = mMinimum.y(); mpCorners[6].z() = mMaximum.z();
00326                         mpCorners[7].x() = mMaximum.x(); mpCorners[7].y() = mMinimum.y(); mpCorners[7].z() = mMaximum.z();
00327 
00328                         return mpCorners;
00329                 }
00330 
00333                 vector<3,T> getCorner(CornerEnum cornerToGet) const
00334                 {
00335                         switch(cornerToGet)
00336                         {
00337                         case FAR_LEFT_BOTTOM:
00338                                 return mMinimum;
00339                         case FAR_LEFT_TOP:
00340                                 return vector<3,T>(mMinimum.x(), mMaximum.y(), mMinimum.z());
00341                         case FAR_RIGHT_TOP:
00342                                 return vector<3,T>(mMaximum.x(), mMaximum.y(), mMinimum.z());
00343                         case FAR_RIGHT_BOTTOM:
00344                                 return vector<3,T>(mMaximum.x(), mMinimum.y(), mMinimum.z());
00345                         case NEAR_RIGHT_BOTTOM:
00346                                 return vector<3,T>(mMaximum.x(), mMinimum.y(), mMaximum.z());
00347                         case NEAR_LEFT_BOTTOM:
00348                                 return vector<3,T>(mMinimum.x(), mMinimum.y(), mMaximum.z());
00349                         case NEAR_LEFT_TOP:
00350                                 return vector<3,T>(mMinimum.x(), mMaximum.y(), mMaximum.z());
00351                         case NEAR_RIGHT_TOP:
00352                                 return mMaximum;
00353                         default:
00354                                 return vector<3,T>();
00355                         }
00356                 }
00357 
00361                 void merge( const AlignedBox3<T>& rhs )
00362                 {
00363                         // Do nothing if rhs null, or this is infinite
00364                         if ((rhs.mExtent == EXTENT_NULL) || (mExtent == EXTENT_INFINITE))
00365                         {
00366                                 return;
00367                         }
00368                         // Otherwise if rhs is infinite, make this infinite, too
00369                         else if (rhs.mExtent == EXTENT_INFINITE)
00370                         {
00371                                 mExtent = EXTENT_INFINITE;
00372                         }
00373                         // Otherwise if current null, just take rhs
00374                         else if (mExtent == EXTENT_NULL)
00375                         {
00376                                 setExtents(rhs.mMinimum, rhs.mMaximum);
00377                         }
00378                         // Otherwise merge
00379                         else
00380                         {
00381                                 vector<3,T> min = mMinimum.cwiseMin(rhs.mMinimum);
00382                                 vector<3,T> max = mMaximum.cwiseMax(rhs.mMaximum);
00383                                 setExtents(min, max);
00384                         }
00385 
00386                 }
00387 
00390                 inline void merge( const vector<3,T>& point )
00391                 {
00392                         switch (mExtent)
00393                         {
00394                         case EXTENT_NULL: // if null, use this point
00395                                 setExtents(point, point);
00396                                 return;
00397 
00398                         case EXTENT_FINITE:
00399                                 mMaximum = mMaximum.cwiseMax(point);
00400                                 mMinimum = mMinimum.cwiseMin(point);
00401                                 return;
00402 
00403                         case EXTENT_INFINITE: // if infinite, makes no difference
00404                                 return;
00405                         }
00406 
00407                         assert( false && "Never reached" );
00408                 }

00474 
00486                 inline void transformAffine(const transform<3, T, Eigen::Affine>& tf)
00487                 {
00488                         // Do nothing if current null or infinite
00489                         if ( mExtent != EXTENT_FINITE )
00490                                 return;
00491 
00492                         vector<3,T> centre = getCenter();
00493                         vector<3,T> halfSize = getHalfSize();
00494 
00495                         matrix<4,4,T> m = tf.matrix();
00496 
00497                         vector<3,T> newCentre = tf * centre;
00498                         vector<3,T> newHalfSize(
00499                                 Math<T>::abs(m(0, 0)) * halfSize.x() + Math<T>::abs(m(0, 1)) * halfSize.y() + Math<T>::abs(m(0, 2)) * halfSize.z(), 
00500                                 Math<T>::abs(m(1, 0)) * halfSize.x() + Math<T>::abs(m(1, 1)) * halfSize.y() + Math<T>::abs(m(1, 2)) * halfSize.z(),
00501                                 Math<T>::abs(m(2, 0)) * halfSize.x() + Math<T>::abs(m(2, 1)) * halfSize.y() + Math<T>::abs(m(2, 2)) * halfSize.z());
00502 
00503                         setExtents(newCentre - newHalfSize, newCentre + newHalfSize);
00504                 }

00537                 {
00538                         return (mExtent == EXTENT_INFINITE);

00542                 inline bool intersects(const AlignedBox3<T>& b2) const
00543                 {
00544                         // Early-fail for nulls
00545                         if (this->isNull() || b2.isNull())
00546                                 return false;
00547 
00548                         // Early-success for infinites
00549                         if (this->isInfinite() || b2.isInfinite())
00550                                 return true;
00551 
00552                         // Use up to 6 separating planes
00553                         if (mMaximum.x() < b2.mMinimum.x())
00554                                 return false;
00555                         if (mMaximum.y() < b2.mMinimum.y())
00556                                 return false;
00557                         if (mMaximum.z() < b2.mMinimum.z())
00558                                 return false;
00559 
00560                         if (mMinimum.x() > b2.mMaximum.x())
00561                                 return false;
00562                         if (mMinimum.y() > b2.mMaximum.y())
00563                                 return false;
00564                         if (mMinimum.z() > b2.mMaximum.z())
00565                                 return false;
00566 
00567                         // otherwise, must be intersecting
00568                         return true;
00569 
00570                 }
00571 
00573                 inline AlignedBox3 intersection(const AlignedBox3<T>& b2) const
00574                 {
00575             if (this->isNull() || b2.isNull())
00576                         {
00577                                 return AlignedBox3();
00578                         }
00579                         else if (this->isInfinite())
00580                         {
00581                                 return b2;
00582                         }
00583                         else if (b2.isInfinite())
00584                         {
00585                                 return *this;
00586                         }
00587 
00588                         vector<3,T> intMin = mMinimum;
00589             vector<3,T> intMax = mMaximum;
00590 
00591             intMin.makeCeil(b2.getMinimum());
00592             intMax.makeFloor(b2.getMaximum());
00593 
00594             // Check intersection isn't null
00595             if (intMin.x() < intMax.x() &&
00596                 intMin.y() < intMax.y() &&
00597                 intMin.z() < intMax.z())
00598             {
00599                 return AlignedBox3(intMin, intMax);
00600             }
00601 
00602             return AlignedBox3();
00603                 }
00604 
00606                 float volume(void) const
00607                 {
00608                         switch (mExtent)
00609                         {
00610                         case EXTENT_NULL:
00611                                 return 0.0f;
00612 
00613                         case EXTENT_FINITE:
00614                                 {
00615                                         vector<3,T> diff = mMaximum - mMinimum;
00616                                         return diff.x() * diff.y() * diff.z();
00617                                 }
00618 
00619                         case EXTENT_INFINITE:
00620                                 return Math<T>::PositiveInfinity;
00621 
00622                         default: // shut up compiler
00623                                 assert( false && "Never reached" );
00624                                 return 0.0f;
00625                         }
00626                 }
00627 
00629                 inline void scale(const vector<3,T>& s)
00630                 {
00631                         // Do nothing if current null or infinite
00632                         if (mExtent != EXTENT_FINITE)
00633                                 return;
00634 
00635                         // NB assumes centered on origin
00636                         vector<3,T> min = mMinimum * s;
00637                         vector<3,T> max = mMaximum * s;
00638                         setExtents(min, max);
00639                 }

00642                 bool intersects(const Sphere<T>& s) const
00643                 {
00644                         return Math<T>::intersects(s, *this); 
00645                 }
00647                 bool intersects(const Plane<T>& p) const
00648                 {
00649                         return Math<T>::intersects(p, *this);
00650                 }
00652                 bool intersects(const vector<3,T>& v) const
00653                 {
00654                         switch (mExtent)
00655                         {
00656                         case EXTENT_NULL:
00657                                 return false;
00658 
00659                         case EXTENT_FINITE:
00660                                 return(v.x() >= mMinimum.x()  &&  v.x() <= mMaximum.x()  && 
00661                                         v.y() >= mMinimum.y()  &&  v.y() <= mMaximum.y()  && 
00662                                         v.z() >= mMinimum.z()  &&  v.z() <= mMaximum.z());
00663 
00664                         case EXTENT_INFINITE:
00665                                 return true;
00666 
00667                         default: // shut up compiler
00668                                 assert( false && "Never reached" );
00669                                 return false;
00670                         }
00671                 }
00673                 vector<3,T> getCenter(void) const
00674                 {
00675                         assert( (mExtent == EXTENT_FINITE) && "Can't get center of a null or infinite AAB" );
00676 
00677                         return vector<3,T>(
00678                                 (mMaximum.x() + mMinimum.x()) * 0.5f,
00679                                 (mMaximum.y() + mMinimum.y()) * 0.5f,
00680                                 (mMaximum.z() + mMinimum.z()) * 0.5f);
00681                 }
00683                 vector<3,T> getSize(void) const
00684                 {
00685                         switch (mExtent)
00686                         {
00687                         case EXTENT_NULL:
00688                                 return vector<3,T>::Zero();
00689 
00690                         case EXTENT_FINITE:
00691                                 return mMaximum - mMinimum;
00692 
00693                         case EXTENT_INFINITE:
00694                                 return vector<3,T>(
00695                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity,
00696                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity,
00697                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity);
00698 
00699                         default: // shut up compiler
00700                                 assert( false && "Never reached" );
00701                                 return vector<3,T>::Zero();
00702                         }
00703                 }
00705                 vector<3,T> getHalfSize(void) const
00706                 {
00707                         switch (mExtent)
00708                         {
00709                         case EXTENT_NULL:
00710                                 return vector<3,T>::Zero();
00711 
00712                         case EXTENT_FINITE:
00713                                 return (mMaximum - mMinimum) * 0.5;
00714 
00715                         case EXTENT_INFINITE:
00716                                 return vector<3,T>(
00717                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity,
00718                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity,
00719                                         Math<T>::PositiveInfinity);
00720 
00721                         default: // shut up compiler
00722                                 assert( false && "Never reached" );
00723                                 return vector<3,T>::Zero();
00724                         }
00725                 }
00726 
00729         bool contains(const vector<3,T>& v) const
00730         {
00731             if (isNull())
00732                 return false;
00733             if (isInfinite())
00734                 return true;
00735 
00736             return mMinimum.x() <= v.x() && v.x() <= mMaximum.x() &&
00737                    mMinimum.y() <= v.y() && v.y() <= mMaximum.y() &&
00738                    mMinimum.z() <= v.z() && v.z() <= mMaximum.z();
00739         }
00740 
00743         bool contains(const AlignedBox3<T>& other) const
00744         {
00745             if (other.isNull() || this->isInfinite())
00746                 return true;
00747 
00748             if (this->isNull() || other.isInfinite())
00749                 return false;
00750 
00751             return this->mMinimum.x() <= other.mMinimum.x() &&
00752                    this->mMinimum.y() <= other.mMinimum.y() &&
00753                    this->mMinimum.z() <= other.mMinimum.z() &&
00754                    other.mMaximum.x() <= this->mMaximum.x() &&
00755                    other.mMaximum.y() <= this->mMaximum.y() &&
00756                    other.mMaximum.z() <= this->mMaximum.z();
00757         }
00758 
00761         bool operator== (const AlignedBox3<T>& rhs) const
00762         {
00763             if (this->mExtent != rhs.mExtent)
00764                 return false;
00765 
00766             if (!this->isFinite())
00767                 return true;
00768 
00769             return this->mMinimum == rhs.mMinimum &&
00770                    this->mMaximum == rhs.mMaximum;
00771         }
00772 
00775         bool operator!= (const AlignedBox3<T>& rhs) const
00776         {
00777             return !(*this == rhs);
00778         }
00779 
00780                 // special values
00781                 static const AlignedBox3 BOX_NULL;
00782                 static const AlignedBox3 BOX_INFINITE;
00783 
00784                 // This method is kinda dangerous. It sets the extent to finite, without any guarantee
00785                 // it's actually going to be so.
00786                 vector<3,T>& operator[]( const size_t i )
00787                 {
00788                         assert( i < 2 );
00789                         mExtent = EXTENT_FINITE;
00790                         if(i == 0) return mMinimum;
00791                         return mMaximum;
00792                 }
00793         
00794                 const vector<3,T>& operator[]( const size_t i ) const
00795                 {
00796                         assert( i < 2 );
00797                         if(i == 0) return mMinimum;
00798                         return mMaximum;
00799                 }
00800 
00801         };
00802 
00803 }
00804 }
00805 #endif
